questions.question_text: Which three item types support defining a list of values? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BDE
BDE is correct, Color Picker (A) does not support a LOV
Its D - I've checked that in my apex environment

choices.D: Set Validation Associated Item to P5_SAL
choices.B: Set Display Location to "Inline with Field"
choices.A: Add JavaScript to the item to display on error
choices.C: Set Value Required to Yes on P5_SAL

questions.question_text:
Kim has defined a validation of "Item is NOT zero" on P5_SAL. When she runs the page, the error is displayed in the notification, but does not highlight the item or display the error below the item. Kim changes Display Location to "Inline with Field and Notification". However, the validation error still does not display under the item.
What must Kim do to ensure that the validation error appears correctly under the item and also in the notification?

You want to use the session state value of a page item in the SELECT statement for a report on another page.
What is the correct way to reference the value of a page item in a SQL statement?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
In release 23.1 is still D the correct answer. We are talking about SQL not PL/SQL I guess
https://docs.oracle.com/en/database/oracle/apex/23.1/htmdb/managing-session-state-values.html#GUID-AC0C208D-61DF-40F6-8CC9-F3D59D24E5D0:~:text=3.9.1-,About%20Referencing%20Session%20State,-Reference%20item%20values
the answer is D, the ':' prevent SQL injection

choices.G: In one of the columns of the detail region, select the related column of the master region for the Master Column attribute.
choices.F: In the detail region, select the correct region for the Master Region attribute.
choices.A: Include a join clause in the SQL Query attribute of the detail interactive grid region.
choices.D: Make the master interactive grid region read-only.
choices.C: In the master region, select the correct region for the Detail Region attribute.
choices.E: Move the detail region below the master region.
choices.B: Enter the name of the foreign key constraint in the Detail Region Foreign Key Relationship attribute.

questions.question_text: Ellie has two related interactive grids on a page. Which two steps must she perform to create a master detail relationship between them? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: FG, Master Region should be chosen in detail region.
I agree it's F and G

questions.question_text:
Carl has created a new region template as a copy of the Standard region template in Universal Theme. He wants to update the template, but is not sure how often the template is used throughout the application.
How can Carl determine all of the pages where his custom template is used?

choices.D: Run the Application Advisor and select Template Utilization
choices.B: Go to Shared Components > Templates, and select References for the given template
choices.C: Go to Application Utilities > Cross Page Utilities and review Page Attributes
choices.A: Go to Application Utilities > Templates and review the utilization report
